thread.title: Woman on mobility scooter causes gridlock on Sunshine Coast road | The Courier-Mail
thread.title_full: Woman on mobility scooter causes gridlock on Sunshine Coast road | The Courier-Mail

title: Woman on mobility scooter causes gridlock on Sunshine Coast road | The Courier-Mail
text:
Woman on mobility scooter causes gridlock on Sunshine Coast road Rachel Lang, Sunshine Coast Daily, News Corp Australia Network February 24, 2017 12:54pm 
AN ELDERLY woman driving a mobility scooter down the centre of a busy Sunshine Coast road has caused traffic chaos. 
Pelican Waters teen Brittney McHugh and a friend were stuck behind the scooter in the Caloundra Rd traffic at around 5.30pm yesterday, the Sunshine Coast Daily reports . 
“She was stopped at the traffic lights turning out of Woolies,” she said. 
“She came onto Caloundra Road and kept going in the middle lane.” 
Roughly 100 cars were banked up due to the slow-moving scooter, she said. media_camera An elderly scooter driver allegedly driving down the middle of a busy Sunshine Coast road. 
“It was banked up through all sets of lights behind us,” Brittney said. 
“It was crazy — there were cars everywhere. 
“The normal traffic is not normally that busy but because it was 5:30 and people were heading home for work — and everyone was slowing down to have a look.” 
Brittney said an ambulance travelling behind their car pulled over to assist the woman. 
We had an ambulance behind us and they pulled over to help her 
“As far as I knew she got up to the next set of lights, heading towards Kings Beach.” 
The 17-year-old said she’d hit record due to the strange cause of the traffic jam. 
“We haven’t seen anything like that before.”
